medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain localized in the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began one day prior, initially in the epigastrium before localizing to the right lower quadrant. The pain is associated with poor oral intake and worsens with movement and leg raises. The patient denies fevers, chills, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.
medical_history.social_history: No history of inflammatory bowel disease.
